title: Providence, RI
content:
Hello fellow typophiles,

I’m going to be moving to Providence in the fall, as my boyfriend attends Brown for playwriting.

I currently don’t know anyone in the Providence area, and am hoping to connect with some type/design people.

Any typophiles in providence? Or know anyone in the area?

I’m also going to reach out to the RISD community, but thought I would start here.

Thanks!

Jeremy

author: JLM

comments.content:
Oy, no offense to Guy Jeffrey Nelson, but I hope Providence has more to offer than that...

j

Jeremy,  
The Rhode Island School of Design (RISD) up on Benefit street near Brown has a very good graphic design department. I would look up their site and check out their campus.

[http://www.risd.edu](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007165216/http:/www.risd.edu/ "http://www.risd.edu")

ChrisL

Hi Jeremy!

I live in nearby Pawtucket, Rhode Island, with my partner of twelve years and his elderly pug... :)

As ChrisL suggests, RISD would be a good place to meet fellow typophiles too.

There isn’t much for bookstores, but in Downtown Providence there is a nice “closeout / remainder” store called Symposium Books with a nice selection of art books. On nearby Matthewson Street is the best used bookstore in the state, Cellar Stories, which also has a decent art/graphic design area (IMHO).

Feel free to contact me at [jshallri@cox.net](mailto:jshallri@cox.net) if you like.

Cheers,  
JohnH the Fontaholic
